definition: to get mad/to be very angry
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: I am so pissed off with his attitude.
Even the mention of his name starts me fuming.
sentences.chinese: 就连提他的名字都让我火大。

sentences.english: I'm really angry about this long wait.
sentences.chinese: 等那么久，实在让我很火大。

sentences.english: I got off and immediately tied one of his front legs up .
sentences.chinese: 我火大了，干脆直接立刻用绳子绑住它的一只前脚。

definition: to get angry/to burn with rage
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to feel agitated/to be troubled/to be annoyed/an upset or distraction
